DOC.brief_summary: "The purpose of this investigator-initiated study is to see if giving dextrose fluid in the veins (IV) decreases the risk of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in female urologic, gynecologic and breast outpatient surgery patients and at what blood surgery level. The reason for this study is that IV dextrose has been shown to decrease the incidence of PONV and the use of medications to treat PONV, while leading to sooner discharge after surgery. This can decrease overall healthcare cost and improving patient satisfaction."
DOC.brief_title: A Closer Look at the Effect of Dextrose on Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting
DOC.criteria: 1. ASA I or II 2. female urologic, gynecologic and breast surgery patients undergoing scheduled same day procedures at LLUMC Heart and Surgical Hospital 1. age <18 or >65; 2. severe hypertension,diabetes mellitus, significant hepatic or renal disease 3. excessive blood loss 4. sustained (>10 min)>20% from baseline drop in BP after treatment 5. inability to follow protocol 6. refusal to sign consent
